com.intland.codebeamer.remoting.client

Class RetryingRemoteApiClientFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intland.codebeamer.remoting.client.RetryingRemoteApiClientFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRemoteApiClientFactory

    public class RetryingRemoteApiClientFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements IRemoteApiClientFactory
    Factory for a remote-api client, which automatically connects/reconnects if necessary, and when a method call on a remote-api fails it will retry the invocations several times.

    Usage: 

     // create an factory instance
 RetryingRemoteApiClientFactory apiFactory = new RetryingRemoteApiClientFactory(new RemoteApiClientFactory(...);

 RemoteApi remoteApi = apiFactory.connect();
 // call the remote-api method:
 // this will actually connect to the remote server, and execute the remote-call
 UserDto users = remoteApi.findAllUsers(apiFactory.getToken());
    Important: When using the remote-api methods always use the getToken() value as token. This will return a "fake" token which will be automatically replaced by the current token, which may change during the times as the factory may reconnects and relogin to the remote-server when the connection lost.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public RemoteApi connect()
                  throws CodebeamerException
        Create a Remote-api proxy which will automatically connect/reconnect, and retry all calls several times. Note: this will NOT connect immediately to the remote server, but just returns a proxy for connecting later!
        Specified by:
        connect in interface IRemoteApiClientFactory
        Returns:
        The remote-api proxy
        Throws:
        CodebeamerException

        Returns:
